title: From 'obsolete' to the 'opposite of that': Trump changes tune on NATO
shortDescription: President Donald Trump has softened his stance on NATO. He once called the Western alliance "obsolete." Now, he says, it's the "opposite of that."

title: What to know about the Education Department as Trump moves to gut it
shortDescription: Here's what to know after a decision by the Supreme Court gives the president a green light to move forward on his promise to gut the agency.

title: Trump considers changing the name 'soccer' to 'football'
shortDescription: 'They call it football, but I guess we call it soccer,’ Trump said in an interview with a sports streaming channel. 'But that change could be made very easily.'

title: Barron Trump: When is the next appearance for very private public figure
shortDescription: Donald and Melania, Trump Jr., Ivanka, Eric, Tiffany, Vanessa, Kai and Donald Trump III have made headlines with their attendance. But where's Barron?

title: Trump looks to dismantle Education Department after court green light
shortDescription: "With this GREAT Supreme Court Decision, our Secretary of Education, Linda McMahon, may begin this very important process," Trump wrote.

title: Russia does not care about Trump's 'theatrical ultimatum', official says
shortDescription: Russia does not care about Trump's ultimatum of sanctions unless Moscow agrees to a peace deal in Ukraine, a senior security official said.

title: Key election to replace late Arizona Democrat: What to know
shortDescription: The race to fill Raúl Grijalva's seat is expected to be a three-way contest, with the former congressman's daughter in the slight lead.

title: Trump gives Putin an ultimatum as pressure builds to sanction Russia
shortDescription: Trump's threat against Russia runs parallel to a Senate-led effort to pass crippling sanctions on countries that buy Russian energy.

title: SCOTUS backs Trump on education cuts
shortDescription: A divided Supreme Court backed Trump’s plan to dismantle the Education Dept. and fire hundreds of federal workers, despite a judge’s earlier pause.

title: Congress looks to codify DOGE cuts
shortDescription: President Trump has asked Congress to claw back $9.4 billion of federal funding made by DOGE. Lawmakers have until July 18 to make that happen.

title: Obama calls on Democrats to 'toughen up' during a fundraiser
shortDescription: As the Democratic party grows increasingly frustrated with its leaders, former President Barack Obama calls on the party to stand up for what's right.

title: English only: Trump clamping down on multilingual federal services
shortDescription: Some federal court rulings have found that failing to provide certain services in other languages can be discriminatory.

title: States sue Trump admin to restore billions in school funding
shortDescription: Unable to adequately budget for the upcoming year, school districts have been scrambling for weeks. Democratic attorneys general are stepping in.

title: 'Oh really?': Trump says his wife Melania has some thoughts on Putin
shortDescription: Melania Trump has highlighted Russia's continued attacks on Ukraine in private conversations, President Trump said on Monday.

title: Supreme Court gives Trump a win, says he can fire Education Department workers
shortDescription: The decision allows Trump to move forward with dismantling the Education Department.

title: Democrats find 'vile' conditions at 'Alligator Alcatraz' migrant jail
shortDescription: The Democratic lawmakers weren't allowed to talk to the detainees or examine their cells.

title: Jeffrey Epstein: How the Trump team promised a blockbuster reveal
shortDescription: President Trump's climbdown on his administration's talk of a Jeffery Epstein "client list" has infuriated the MAGA movement.

title: Rosie O’Donnell fires back after Trump’s citizenship threat
shortDescription: Rosie O’Donnell has fired back after U.S. President Donald Trump threatened to revoke her citizenship, calling her “a threat to humanity” and saying she should stay in Ireland.

title: US trade partners react to Trump's 30% tariffs
shortDescription: Key trade partners reacted to President Donald Trump's announcement of 30% tariff on goods from certain countries, saying they hope to make a deal.
